message: When did Email become a standard?
body: The proposal for email to become a standard was in 1973. It became finished in 1977 by Arpanet. They added features like a from field, and the ability to forward emails.

message: When did the first email program gain popularity?
body:
In 1979 the first actual email program began to gain widespread popularity. It was made by 14 year old Shiva Ayyaduari in which she created a program called email for the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jearsy.

In 1982, she got the term email copyrighted, and alter on services with their own takes on email were popping up.

message: What were some impacts or effects of email?
body:
• Email largely reduced the amount of traditional mail that was sent.
  • Email is recorded, so the record remains, compared to person-to-person communication which is a hassle to record
  • Email is also accessible from anywhere, unlike text which is tied to a number/app/device, but many email clients allow you login from a web browser anywhere!

message: The good have been mentioned, what about the bad effects?
body:
• Email reduced the amount fo face-to-face communication. For example, an employee could just email his boss instead of scheduling a time to meet with him face-to-face.
  • Forwarded conversations are too long and can cause the main stuff to be lost. As their is so much metadata included, often reading through a forwarded conversation, you will be skipping so much info, that by accidentally you skipped through a 1 line in the email which was important.
